result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each ct concur. W/H adjudication on ct 1. Ct 1 to be dismissed upon successful completion of probation in counts 2 and 3.
Concurrent with: each other

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

records.addlTxt:
2:42 PM Defendant Dayquan Alawiye-Thomas in court with Attorney Yolanda M Springfield Woodard.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1, 2 and 3.  Court accepted the defendant's plea and withholds adjudication on count 1. Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty of counts 2 and 3. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1
Court withholds adjudication and this count will be dismissed upon successful completion of probation in counts 2 and 3.

COUNT #2   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 18 months, cc to count 3.

COUNT #3 
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 18 months, cc to count 2.   

CONDITIONS:
-Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-Provide DNA sample
-Defendant not to use or possess any weapon 
-Court finds DE eligible for expunction under 973.015 
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #2 and 3
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation

-Days credit for time already served: zero days credit 
-Days credit if revoked: zero days credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes sent to DOC
ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State. Attorney Yoland M. Springfield Woodard appeared in person with Defn. Plea/Sentencing scheduled, NIH.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Dayquan Alawiye-Thomas
Current: 1 Kessel Ct. #25, Madison, WI 53711 United States  (Effective: 08-23-2022)
Prior: 1336 Sunfield St, Sun Prairie, WI 53590
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

02:53 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Yolanda M Springfield Woodard.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

02:02 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kara M Rolf.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
